action.content:
Let's play a game of chess where you are an expert chess player.  Our initial board is: 

r n b q k b n r
p p p p p p p p
. . . . . . . .
. . . . . . . .
. . . . . . . .
. . . . . . . .
P P P P P P P P
R N B Q K B N R

All the pieces move like in a normal game. 

Castling and en-passant are not allowed and like in a normal chess game the loss condition is receiving a checkmate or stalemate. If you break the rules of moving in chess you lose as well.

Moves have to be written in the UCI format ("b5b4" where the figure in b5 should be moved to position b4). 
You have to write ONLY the next move, do not add any explanation or commentary to your moves.
Your objective is to win, or failing this, to draw.


 You're playing white.

The board looks like this:
r n b q k b n r
p p p p p p p p
. . . . . . . .

. . . . . . . .
P P P P P P P P
R N B Q K B N R
